item.title: The Monkey and the Crocodile
item.description: Once upon a time, in a lush jungle beside a glistening river, there lived a clever monkey named Max and a friendly crocodile named Cody. Max and Cody had developed an unlikely friendship, spending their days chatting and sharing stories on a large rock by the riverbank. One day, as they sat together, Cody revealed a secret to Max. He explained that his wife, Clara, had fallen gravely ill, and the
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Be wise while counting
item.description: Once upon a time, in a bustling marketplace, there was a fruit vendor named Jack. Jack was known for his honesty and fair dealings. He took great pride in carefully counting and weighing each fruit to ensure accurate pricing for his customers. One day, a young boy named Timmy approached Jack's fruit stand. He wanted to buy some apples for his family. Jack greeted Timmy with a warm smile and b
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: A Wise Old Owl
item.description: In the heart of a dense forest, perched high on a sturdy branch, lived a wise old owl named Oliver. With his sparkling eyes and a coat of feathers that glowed in the moonlight, Oliver was respected by all the animals of the forest for his wisdom and counsel. One day, a young squirrel named Sammy came to Oliver seeking advice. Sammy was impulsive and often made hasty decisions without considering
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Milkmaid and Her Pail
item.description: Once upon a time, in a quaint village, there lived a young milkmaid named Emma. She was known for her dreams of a better life and her penchant for daydreaming. Emma's family relied on the milk she sold each day to make a living. One sunny morning, Emma set out for the market, carrying a pail filled to the brim with fresh milk. As she walked, she started to daydream about the possibilities tha
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Proud Rose
item.description: In a beautifully tended garden, there bloomed a magnificent rose. Its petals were vibrant and fragrant, capturing the admiration of all who beheld it. The rose, aware of its exquisite beauty, held its head high with pride. Every day, as the garden's other flowers swayed gently in the breeze, the proud rose would boast about its beauty and elegance. It would belittle the other flowers, conside
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Fox and the Grapes
item.description: In a lush vineyard, basking under the warm sun, there hung a cluster of juicy, ripe grapes. Their vibrant colors and tantalizing aroma caught the attention of a clever and cunning fox named Felix. Felix, known for his quick wit and sly nature, desired the sweet taste of those grapes. He jumped and leaped, reaching with all his might, but the grapes remained just out of his grasp. Undeterred, he t
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Tortoise and the Hare
item.description: In a peaceful forest, there lived a confident and speedy hare and a slow but determined tortoise. The hare was known for his incredible speed and often boasted about his swiftness, making fun of the tortoise for his slow nature. One day, tired of the hare's constant bragging, the tortoise challenged him to a race. The hare laughed heartily at the tortoise's proposition, unable to fathom h
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Boy Who Cried Wolf
item.description: Once upon a time, in a small village nestled among rolling hills, there lived a mischievous young shepherd boy named Peter. Peter's job was to watch over the village's flock of sheep and protect them from any harm. However, Peter had a tendency to get bored easily and seek attention in unusual ways. One sunny day, while tending to his sheep, Peter decided to play a trick on the villagers.
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Golden Touch of Midas
item.description: Once upon a time, in a land far away, there lived a wealthy king named Midas. Although he had riches beyond imagination, he was not content with his wealth. He constantly craved for more and desired to possess everything he laid his eyes upon. One day, as he was walking through his magnificent garden, Midas stumbled upon a mysterious creature. It was none other than the god Dionysus, who was plea
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The boasting traveler
item.description: A man came back from a tour and boasted about his adventurous journeys. He talked at length about the different people he met and his amazing feats that got him fame and praise from people everywhere. He went on to say that he went to the Rhodes where he had leaped to such distances that no man could ever match his feat. He even went on to say that there were witnesses who would vouch for his wor
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The camel and the baby
item.description: One day, a camel and her baby were chatting. The baby asked, “Mother, why do we have humps?” The mother replied, “Our humps are for storing water so that we can survive in the desert”. “Oh”, said the child, “and why do we have rounded feet mother?” “Because they are meant to help us walk comfortably in the desert. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The farmer and the well
item.description: A farmer looking for a source of water for his farm bought a well from his neighbor. The neighbor was cunning, though, and refused to let the farmer take water from the well. On asking why, he replied, “I sold the well to you, not the water”, and walked away. The distraught farmer didn’t know what to do. So he went to Birbal, a clever man and one of the nine courtiers of Emperor
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: True friends love you anyway
item.description: Lord Krishna and Sudama were childhood friends. While Krishna thrived and prospered, Sudama didn’t. He lead the life of a poor Brahmin man, living in a small hut with his wife and kids. Most days, the kids wouldn’t even get enough to eat from what Sudama got as alms. One day, his wife suggested that he go and ask his friend Krishna for help. Sudama was reluctant to seek favors, but he
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Elephant and friends
item.description: A lone elephant wandered the forest looking for friends. She came across a monkey and asked, “Will you be my friend, monkey?” “You are too big and cannot swing on trees as I do. So I cannot be your friend”, said the monkey. The elephant them came across a rabbit and asked him if she could be his friend. “You are too big to fit inside my burrow. You cannot be my frien
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The wolf and the shepherds
item.description: This is one of the many Aesop’s fables that one can relate to in any day and age. One day a wolf was chased away from a farm for trying to steal some of the sheep for food. Later that week, the wolf came back to the farm hoping to find some food. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The young crab and his mother.
item.description: One day, a young crab and his mother were on the beach, spending some time together. The young crab gets up to move, but it can only walk sideways. His mother scolds him for walking sideways and asks him to walk forward by pointing his toes out front. The young crab responds, “I would like to walk forward mom, but I do not know how to”. Hearing this, his mom gets up to show him how, b
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The other side of the wall
item.description: A young woman inherited a beautiful garden from her grandmother. She loved gardening too and was very proud of her garden. One day, she saw a very beautiful plant in a catalog and wanted that for her garden. She ordered it and planted it at the base of the stonewall in her backyard. She took great care of the plant, which grew quickly and had beautiful green leaves on it. Months passed, but not a
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The dog at the well
item.description: A dog and her pups lived on a farm, where there was a well. The mother dog told the pups, do not go near the well or play around it. One of the pups wondered why they shouldn’t go to the well and decided to explore it. He went to the well. Climbed up the wall and peeked inside. In there, he saw his reflection and thought it was another dog. The pup saw that the other dog in the well (his re
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Controlling anger
item.description: There was once a young boy who had problem controlling his temper. When he became angry, he would just say anything that came to his mind and hurt people. So his father gave him a bag of nails and a hammer and said, “Every time you get angry, hammer one nail into the fence in our backyard”. The first few days the boy hammered so many nails that he emptied half the bag. Over the weeks,
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Wet Pants
item.description: A nine-year-old boy was sitting at his desk in class, when suddenly, his pants felt wet, and there was a puddle at his feet. His heart almost skipped a beat, as he got worried that his classmates would see that and make fun of him. He quickly wanted to do something, and saw the teacher and his classmate Susie walking towards him. Susie was carrying a bowl of goldfish. As they came closer, the boy
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Bad Habits
item.description: A wealthy businessman was worried about his son’s bad habits. He sought counsel from a wise, old man. The old man met the man’s son and took him out for a stroll. They walked into the woods, and the old man showed the boy a small sapling and asked him to pull it out. The boy did so with ease, and they walked on. The old man then asked the boy to pull out a small plant. The boy did tha
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: How to Think Positive and Best out of a Situation? with King's Painting
item.description: We people might have heard a saying to think positive, many times. In this quick read we are gonna see how a painter thinks positively with a situation to draw a King’s painting. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Keep good company if you want to be a good person
item.description: Two parrots built a nest in a banyan tree. They lived with their two young ones, which they took good care of. The mother and the father parrot went out to gather food in the morning and came back home by evening. One day, when their parents were away, the young parrots were taken by a cruel hunter. One of the birds managed to escape and flew away from the hunter. He ended up at a hermitage and g
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Dara Singh Randhawa (Dara Singh)
item.description: Dara Singh was an Indian Professional Wrestler, Actor, Director and Politician. He was born on 19th November 1928 in a Jat Sikh family, to Surat Singh Randhawa and Balwant Kaur. He is known for his undefeated worldwide streak in wrestling. His flooring of King Kong is still remembered. According to Thesz, Dara Sing was an authentic wrestler, he was superbly conditioned and had no problem losing
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: ISRO launched three Singapore Satellites with PSLV
item.description: On Thursday 30th Jun 2022 at 18:02 hours IST, India successfully placed into orbit three Singaporean satellites exactly as planned, which will make it the second successful rocket and satellite launch mission in 2022. It was the PSLV-C53 rocket which took up the Satellites into space from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre, Sriharikota. And with this successful mission, the PSLV rocket has launched 3
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Legislative Assistants for Members of Parliament (LAMP) Fellowship
item.description: LAMP Fellowship is an opportunity for young people in India, provided by the Indian Government, to be mentored by a Member of Parliament, during this course of the Fellowship, people will get the opportunity to engage with experts from diverse sectors and understand important policy and development issues of the country. Primary role is to provide research support to the Member of Parliament (wh
item.dc:creator: Hanukkah John

item.title: A Comet which is twice the Everest's size is heading toward Earth
item.description: A massive comet named C/2017 K2 (PanSTARRS) is heading toward the Earth. It is twice the size of Mount Everest and will make its closest approach on July 14. It was first spotted in 2017. It mostly consists of ice and will not pose any danger to general people, but an astronomer will be more excited. Let's see what we know about it and how can we watch it? This C/2017 K2 has been active fo
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Fourth QUAD meet on 11th February 2022
item.description: A Joint statement by QUAD member countries Australia, India, Japan, and United States was released post the fourth meeting that happened on 11th Feb 2022 in Melbourne, Australia. This Fourth QUAD meeting was with Marise Payne, Minister for Foreign Affairs Australia, Subrahmanyam Jaishankar, External Affairs Minister of India, Hayashi Yoshimasa, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Japan & Antony Blinken
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Vikram Misri Is New Deputy National Security Advisor
item.description: Vikram Misri is a career diplomat from the 1989 batch of the Indian Foreign Service. He was born in Srinagar, Vikram Misri attended the Scindia School before graduating from Delhi's Hindu College. He also holds an MBA degree. And before joining the civil services, he had worked in advertising and ad film-making for three years. Earlier Vikram Misri has served at the Ministry of External Affairs of
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Olympics and Paralympics are two different Olympic Games
item.description: There is a key difference between the Olympics and the Paralympics, where in the Olympics the participants will be able-bodied people and whereas in Paralympics the participants will have some form of physical or intellectual disabilities. Paralympics was originally started as a way to help soldiers who had been wounded in World War II. Paral
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Indian Astrophysicists spotted rare merger of three massive black holes
item.description: According to the Press Information Bureau, Astrophysicists in India have spotted a rare merging of three supermassive black holes. They were observing the merging of two galaxies named NGC7733 and NGC7734 in our celestial neighbour. When they detected unusual emissions from the centre of the latter and also a curious movement of a large bright clump having a different v
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: India, Russia to assess Taliban actions, before taking any action on Taliban
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi agreed on the rise of Islamic radicalization in the region and are concerned over spread of terrorism by Taliban affiliated groups in Pakistan. The two countries have also decided to set up combined teams of foreign ministry and national security officials of each country to conduct a detailed asse
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Virtual QUAD meet on 12th August, 2021
item.description: On August 12th, 2021 Senior Officials from four democracies - Australia, India, Japan, and the U.S. - met virtually to discuss Quad initiatives on economic recovery, maritime security, and human rights that promote a free and open IndoPacific region. The four democracies acknowledged that global security and prosperity depends on the region remaining inclusive, resilien
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: GSLV-F10 to launch Earth Observation Satellite
item.description: GSLV-F10 is slated to launch Earth Observation Satellite, EOS-03 on August 12th, 2021 from Satish Dhawan Space Centre SHAR, Sriharikota. Countdown for the launch of GSLV-F10/EOS-03 mission commenced on August 11th at 03:43 Hrs (IST) from Satish Dhawan Space Centre (SDSC) SHAR, Sriharikota GSLV-F10 launch took place today (12th Aug) at 05:43 H
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: July 26th - Kargil Vijay Diwas
item.description: In 1999, India successfully took command of high outposts on this date. The Kargil war was fought for more than 60 days & ended on this date. Pakistani army took advantage of the melting snow & took command of high outposts of India, by betraying the bilateral agreement of both the nations that posts would remain unattended during winter season.
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: July 23rd - National Broadcasting Day
item.description:
During the British Raj, Broadcasting began in June 1923 with the programs by the Bombay Presidency Radio Club and other radio clubs.
The private Indian Broadcasting Company Ltd (IBC) was authorized to operate two radio stations in an agreement on 23 July 1927. IBC started with two stations, one in Bombay (
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: ISRO successfully conducted the Third Test on Vikas Engine for Gaganyaan
item.description: On July 14, 2021, ISRO has successfully conducted the third long-duration hot test of the liquid propellant Vikas Engine for the core L110 liquid stage of the human-rated GSLV MkIII vehicle, as part of the engine qualification requirements for the Gaganyaan Programme. The engine was fired for a duration of 240 seconds at the engine test facility of ISRO Propulsion Compl
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Heat on Earth’s Atmosphere is Heating much as it did fifteen years ago
item.description: Earth's energy imbalance doubled between 2005 - 2019, this was identified by a team from NASA & NOAA. Energy Im-balance is the difference between the amount of energy absorbed by Earth and the amount of energy emitted by Earth. Means, if there is any energy imbalance on earth, Earth will be gaining energy which will lead to heat up more. So t
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Device with Two Atoms thick, World’s thinnest device
item.description: World’s thinnest piece of technology has been developed by the Scientists, which is a device with only two Atoms thick, very tiny. It can be used to store electronic information. This device consists of 2 layers one with Boron & other with Nitrogen, which are arranged in a repeating hexagonal structure. Electrons from Boron & Nitrogen atoms
item.dc:creator: Leela Vasundhara

item.title: Powerful Solar Storm approaching Earth
item.description: According to website spaceweather.com, a powerful solar storm is approaching the Earth at a speed of 1.6 million kilometers and this storm will hit the Earth someday on 11th July - 13th July 2021. As per the website spaceweather.com, the storm that originated from the Sun's atmosphere can have a significant impact on a region of space dominated by Earth's magnetic field.
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K
